Name: USS Currier
Fate: Sunk as target off California on 11 July 1967
Propulsion:
2 boilers, General Electric Turbo-electric drive
2 solid manganese-bronze 3600 lb 3-bladed propellers, 8.5 ft (2.6 m) diameter, 7 ft 7 in (2.31 m) pitch
12,000 hp (8.9 MW)
2 rudders
Range:
359 tons oil
3,700 nautical miles (6,900 km) at 15 knots (28 km/h)
6,000 nautical miles (11,000 km) at 12 knots (22 km/h)
Armament:
3 × 3 in (76 mm) cal. guns (76.2 mm) (3x1)
4 × 1.1"/75 caliber gun Anti-Aircraft guns (1x4)
8 × 20 mm (8x1)
3 ×  21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes (1x3)
1 × hedgehog projector
8 × K-gun depth charge projectors
2 × depth charge tracks
